articles.headline: Obama Pick for Court Is 3rd in a Row Blocked by Republicans
articles.snippet: In blocking Judge Robert L. Wilkins’s nomination, Senate Republicans on Monday denied President Obama his third pick in recent weeks to fill a vacancy on the nation’s most powerful and prestigious appeals court.
articles.abstract: In blocking Judge Robert L. Wilkins’s nomination, Senate Republicans on Monday denied President Obama his third pick in recent weeks to fill a vacancy on the nation’s most powerful and prestigious appeals court.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Senate Republicans on Monday blocked President Obama’s third consecutive nominee to the country’s most powerful and prestigious appeals court and insisted they would not back down, inflaming a bitter debate over a president’s right to shape the judiciary.

articles.headline: New Market Benchmarks Show a Lack of Options
articles.snippet: A consensus of professional strategists became convinced months ago that compared with bonds, stocks were a good bet.
articles.abstract: A consensus of professional strategists became convinced months ago that compared with bonds, stocks were a good bet.
articles.lead_paragraph: Stocks rallied past two psychological barriers Monday morning, pushing the Dow Jones industrial average over 16,000 and the Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index beyond 1,800 for the first time, as investors still saw opportunities in the market.

articles.headline: Regulators See Value in Bitcoin, and Investors Hasten to Agree
articles.snippet: Federal officials told a Senate hearing that virtual currencies like bitcoin offered real benefits for the financial system.
articles.abstract: Federal officials told a Senate hearing that virtual currencies like bitcoin offered real benefits for the financial system.
articles.lead_paragraph: The virtual currency bitcoin took a big step toward the mainstream on Monday as federal authorities signaled their willingness to accept it as a legitimate payment alternative.

articles.headline: A Conflict in Geithner’s New Job? Not Exactly
articles.snippet: There’s something quite odd about the developing narrative about Timothy F. Geithner’s move, because it is hard to argue Mr. Geithner ever spun through the revolving door even once.
articles.abstract: There’s something quite odd about the developing narrative about Timothy F. Geithner’s move, because it is hard to argue Mr. Geithner ever spun through the revolving door even once.
articles.lead_paragraph: Within 24 hours of Timothy F. Geithner’s announcement on Saturday that he would join Warburg Pincus, the private equity firm, a parade of naysayers emerged, almost like clockwork, to criticize the former Treasury secretary’s move as a prime example of the evil of the government’s revolving door.

articles.headline: Labor Panel Finds Illegal Punishments at Walmart
articles.snippet: Walmart denied the accusations and said it would defend itself, asserting that its actions were “legal and justified.”
articles.abstract: Walmart denied the accusations and said it would defend itself, asserting that its actions were “legal and justified.”
articles.lead_paragraph: Walmart illegally disciplined and fired employees over strikes and protests, the National Labor Relations Board said on Monday.

articles.headline: Hollywood Studios Facing Upheaval at Highest Levels
articles.snippet: A rolling realignment, seemingly change for change’s sake, has knocked out executives and producers at several major studios.
articles.abstract: A rolling realignment, seemingly change for change’s sake, has knocked out executives and producers at several major studios.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Advice for the power players at Hollywood’s coming round of black-tie galas: Don’t leave your seat to table-hop.
articles.byline: By Michael Cieply and Brooks Barnes

articles.headline: Split on Accord on Iran Strains U.S.-Israel Ties
articles.snippet: The disagreement between American and Israeli leaders over a proposed deal to freeze Iran’s nuclear program is about more than negotiating tactics — it reflects a clash of fundamental goals.
articles.abstract: The disagreement between American and Israeli leaders over a proposed deal to freeze Iran’s nuclear program is about more than negotiating tactics — it reflects a clash of fundamental goals.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — To the Israeli government, the preliminary deal with Iran that the Obama administration is trying to seal this week is a giveaway to a government that has spent two decades building a vast nuclear program. It enshrines the status quo — at a time when the Iranians are within reach of the technical capability to build a bomb — and rewards some unproven leaders with cash and sanctions relief.
articles.byline: By David E. Sanger and Jodi Rudoren

articles.headline: His Honor? Toronto’s Mayor Rampages On, to City’s Shame
articles.snippet: Despite the bizarre antics of Mayor Rob Ford, most notably his use of crack, he will likely remain at the helm of Canada’s largest city until his term ends next year.
articles.abstract: Despite the bizarre antics of Mayor Rob Ford, most notably his use of crack, he will likely remain at the helm of Canada’s largest city until his term ends next year.
articles.lead_paragraph: TORONTO — The end did not come for Rob Ford, the mayor of this city, when he proclaimed his proclivity for oral sex on live television.
articles.byline: By Jennifer Steinhauer and Ian Austen

articles.headline: In Middle of Mexico, a Middle Class Rises
articles.snippet: In the mostly poor state of Guanajuato, long known as one of the country’s main sources of illegal immigrants to the United States, a new Mexico has begun to emerge.
articles.abstract: In the mostly poor state of Guanajuato, long known as one of the country’s main sources of illegal immigrants to the United States, a new Mexico has begun to emerge.
articles.lead_paragraph: GUANAJUATO, Mexico — A decade ago, Ivan Zamora, 23, might have already left for the United States. Instead, he graduated in May from a gleaming new university here, then moved on to an engineering internship at one of the many multinational companies just beyond the campus gates.

articles.headline: John Edwards Revisits His Past, Hanging Law Shingle Again
articles.snippet: The path back for Mr. Edwards began when his legal troubles ended last year. Prosecutors had charged him with misusing nearly $1 million in campaign donations.
articles.abstract: The path back for Mr. Edwards began when his legal troubles ended last year. Prosecutors had charged him with misusing nearly $1 million in campaign donations.
articles.lead_paragraph: Before he served as a United States senator, before he made a run at the presidency and before his political career collapsed amid a sex scandal and fraud trial, John Edwards was a trial lawyer.
articles.byline: By Peter Lattman and Kim Severson

articles.headline: Beirut Bombs Strike at Iran as Assad’s Ally
articles.snippet: The attack appeared to broaden the violent pattern of division across the Middle East linked to the civil war in Syria, where Iran has emerged as a powerful ally of the government side.
articles.abstract: The attack appeared to broaden the violent pattern of division across the Middle East linked to the civil war in Syria, where Iran has emerged as a powerful ally of the government side.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — A double bombing struck the Iranian Embassy compound in Beirut on Tuesday, in the deadliest assault on Iran’s interests since it emerged as the most forceful backer of the Syrian government against an armed insurgency. The frontal attack struck a symbol of the country’s powerful influence in Lebanon and neighboring Syria.
articles.byline: By Anne Barnard, Thomas Erdbrink and Rick Gladstone

articles.headline: After 3 Fires, Safety Agency Opens Inquiry Into Tesla Model S
articles.snippet: After a third battery fire in a Tesla car in six weeks, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said Tuesday that it had started a formal investigation.
articles.abstract: After a third battery fire in a Tesla car in six weeks, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said Tuesday that it had started a formal investigation.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT — A federal safety investigation of the Tesla Motors electric Model S sedan announced on Tuesday comes at a critical juncture for the car and the company.
articles.byline: By Bill Vlasic and Jaclyn Trop
